de.esoco.lib.property

Class StringProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.property.AbstractStringProperties
      • de.esoco.lib.property.StringProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasProperties, MutableProperties, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDataSet, SimpleColumnDefinition

    public class StringProperties
extends AbstractStringProperties
implements MutableProperties, java.io.Serializable
    This class implements a property mapping that encodes all property values as strings. See the implemented interface MutableProperties for details.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(HasProperties rOther,
                          boolean bReplace)
        Sets all properties from another properties object in this instance. The boolean parameter controls whether existing properties will be replaced or ignored.

        It depends on the actual implementations whether all properties from the other instance can be copied correctly into the target instance. It is therefore recommended to use this method only with properties objects of the same or a compatible type. Implementations should indicate incompatible data formats by throwing a runtime exception.

        Specified by:
        setProperties in interface MutableProperties
        Parameters:
        rOther - The instance to copy the properties from
        bReplace - TRUE to replace existing value, FALSE to only add non-existing values

      • setProperty

        public <T> void setProperty(PropertyName<T> rName,
                            T rValue)
        Default implementation of MutableProperties.setProperty(PropertyName, Object). Creates the property map if necessary and removes properties if the value is NULL.
        Specified by:
        setProperty in interface MutableProperties
        Overrides:
        setProperty in class AbstractStringProperties
        Parameters:
        rName - The property to set or remove
        rValue - The property value or NULL to remove
